history.text: HI!. I want you to check out The Shape of Water by Guillermo del Toro.
Hello, that movie sounds interesting. Could you give a little review?
It has Rotten Tomatoes 92% rating, and got an A from CinemaScore. It is an American fantasy drama, a love story
Great, what is the plot?
The plot is about a mute cleaner who works in a secret government lab, and falls in love with an amphibian being trapped in the lab.
That sounds intriguing, and how that amphibian got the lab?
The amphibian was captured in the Amazon River, and brought to the lab to study
They are trying to study the amphibian so that they can get an edge over the Russians during the arms race.
They stun and immobilize the creature, and then lock him in the lab for study
Awesome, fantasy and thrilling argument of the rivalry between U.S. and the Soviets.
Yeah! And don't forget it won a bunch of awards, including best picture.
The main characters are played by who?
Sally Hawkins plays the mute cleaner,
Also there is Michael Shannon as the antagonist, Richard Jenkins as Elisa's friend, and Octavia Spencer as her friend also.
I am not really familiar with Sally Hawkins, however Michael Shannon  and Richard Jenkins are great actors!
I should take some time to see this movie, definitely.
Yeah I agree! Michael Shannon makes a great enemy, and Richard Jenkins is always a great character actor.
Yes, I always try to check out the movies that win Best Picture. More often than not they are good.
Do you know how we tell when we are done?

Yeah, I have that habit too. And Guillermo del Toro totally deserved that award. His work is always pleasant to watch
!
Yeah, I liked Pan's Labyrinth too
I try to follow what he is doing and watch most of his films
Do you know what else we are supposed to do for this HIT? I'm not sure what the next step is
Surely, Pan's Labyrinth is one of the movies for what he will be remembered.
Yes, he has a way of creating different worlds and interesting creatures.
Do you something else about the Shape of Water? Some fun facts or something?
Yeah, I found it kinda weird to have love scenes between the human and the amphibian! hehe
But everything is done pretty artfully etc
Well, it is kind of funny but it was already done in previous movies such as The Little Mermaid I think, but less visually of course.
The main character uses sign language to talk to the creature.

You have to realize, that the main character was orphaned and ALSO found in a river,
 with wounds on her neck.
That makes perfect sense, since Hally is acting as a mute. That would imply that this creature is quite smart too.

What were the shape of those neck 
marks?
Yes, it is definitely implied. There is a lot of symbolism and allegory in the film.
They are like slashes from a knife..., kinda mirroring the gills of the amphibian creature.
That is highly curious, could you describe some film scenes?

Sure. Elisa (main character
) keeps the creature in her bathtub, with salts. He cannot survive that long out of water.

uid1response.feedback: This was a fun AI task!
